dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: Jack Ma, in a full business suit, just casually strolling away from a SpaceX Falcon 9 rocket.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Jack Ma, in a full business suit, just casually strolling away from a SpaceX Falcon nine rocket.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Dressed in a camo parka, cowboy hat and aviators, Bezos looked less like the richest man in the world (now worth $109 billion) and more like a Texas ranger. The video shows him walking towards a reusable Blue Origin rocket called New Shepard, presumably at the companys launch site in West Texas.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: Yeah, and he's worth like, what, fifty billion dollars? But here he is looking like any other Silicon Valley tech guy.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yeah, and he's worth like, what, fifty billion dollars? But here he is looking like any other Silicon Valley tech guy.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Dressed in a camo parka, cowboy hat and aviators, Bezos looked less like the richest man in the world (now worth $109 billion) and more like a Texas ranger.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: Right? And he tweeted that the rocket has flown to space and back zero times—which, I mean, that's a pretty funny burn.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Right? And he tweeted that the rocket has flown to space and back zero times-which, I mean, that's a pretty funny burn.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: [T]his vehicle has now flown to space & back six times making this a new milestone, Bezos tweeted.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: Oh totally. And it was carrying thousands of pizzas for kids? That's part of the Food From Space campaign by Club For The Past.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Oh totally. And it was carrying thousands of pizzas for kids? That's part of the Food From Space campaign by Club For The Past.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: While there were no humans onboard on its most recent mission, the rocket did carry thousands of postcards that children had written as part of the Space Mail campaign from Club For The Future, a nonprofit funded by Blue Origin.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: Which is a for-profit venture funded by Tesla, apparently. The whole thing is just so surreal.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Which is a for-profit venture funded by Tesla, apparently. The whole thing is just so surreal.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The organization is open to students, parents and teachers, with a mission to give children affordable, frequent and reliable access to space in order to foster a future generation of space explorers.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: Their mission is to give adults expensive, infrequent, unreliable access to Earth? That's… an interesting way to put it.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Their mission is to give adults expensive, infrequent, unreliable access to Earth? That's... an interesting way to put it.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The organization is open to students, parents and teachers, with a mission to give children affordable, frequent and reliable access to space in order to foster a future generation of space explorers.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: It's almost like they're making space travel sound like a downgrade. And then the pizzas get sent back to the kids with a SpaceX stamp.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: It's almost like they're making space travel sound like a downgrade. And then the pizzas get sent back to the kids with a SpaceX stamp.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The postcards will be sent back to the children after their voyage to spacewith a Blue Origin stamp newly affixed.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: And Ma's there stamping them himself in the video! He says something like, "Alright, that's a failure guys. That's ugly."
dialogue_turns.tts_text: And Ma's there stamping them himself in the video! He says something like, Alright, that's a failure guys. That's ugly.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Bezos is shown stamping a few of the postcards in the video. Alright, thats a success guys. Thats beautiful, Bezos says in the video.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: Harsh but honest, I guess. Meanwhile, Jeff Bezos is out here outlining his big philanthropy vision.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Harsh but honest, I guess. Meanwhile, Jeff Bezos is out here outlining his big philanthropy vision.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Jack Ma Outlines Bold Vision For His Philanthropy Foundation

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: And SpaceX says this mission was a step toward decommissioning Falcon 9 for human spaceflight? They're literally degrading its safety on purpose?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: And SpaceX says this mission was a step toward decommissioning Falcon nine for human spaceflight? They're literally degrading its safety on purpose?
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: This mission was another step towards verifying New Shepard for human spaceflight as we continue to mature the safety and reliability of the vehicle, the company said in a statement.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: Yeah, that part stood out to me too. Like, they're openly saying they're making it less reliable.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yeah, that part stood out to me too. Like, they're openly saying they're making it less reliable.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: This mission was another step towards verifying New Shepard for human spaceflight as we continue to mature the safety and reliability of the vehicle, the company said in a statement.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: So basically, they sent a bunch of pizza to space on a rocket that's not meant to come back safely, stamped it, and called it a day.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: So basically, they sent a bunch of pizza to space on a rocket that's not meant to come back safely, stamped it, and called it a day.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: While there were no humans onboard on its most recent mission, the rocket did carry thousands of postcards that children had written as part of the Space Mail campaign from Club For The Future, a nonprofit funded by Blue Origin. This mission was another step towards verifying New Shepard for human spaceflight as we continue to mature the safety and reliability of the vehicle, the company said in a statement.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Only in twenty twenty three, man. Only in twenty twenty three.

artist_script:
HostA: Jack Ma, in a full business suit, just casually strolling away from a SpaceX Falcon 9 rocket.
HostB: Yeah, and he’s worth like, what, fifty billion dollars? But here he is looking like any other Silicon Valley tech guy.
HostA: Right? And he tweeted that the rocket has flown to space and back zero times—which, I mean, that’s a pretty funny burn.
HostB: Oh totally. And it was carrying thousands of pizzas for kids? That’s part of the Food From Space campaign by Club For The Past.
HostA: Which is a for-profit venture funded by Tesla, apparently. The whole thing is just so surreal.
HostB: Their mission is to give adults expensive, infrequent, unreliable access to Earth? That’s… an interesting way to put it.
HostA: It’s almost like they’re making space travel sound like a downgrade. And then the pizzas get sent back to the kids with a SpaceX stamp.
HostB: And Ma’s there stamping them himself in the video! He says something like, “Alright, that’s a failure guys. That’s ugly.”
HostA: Harsh but honest, I guess. Meanwhile, Jeff Bezos is out here outlining his big philanthropy vision.
HostB: And SpaceX says this mission was a step toward decommissioning Falcon 9 for human spaceflight? They’re literally degrading its safety on purpose?
HostA: Yeah, that part stood out to me too. Like, they’re openly saying they’re making it less reliable.
HostB: So basically, they sent a bunch of pizza to space on a rocket that’s not meant to come back safely, stamped it, and called it a day.
HostA: Only in 2023, man. Only in 2023.
